intro: Angraecum oliganthum, commonly known as the rare Madagascar orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the island of Madagascar and is characterized by its unique, fragrant, white flowers that bloom at night. The plant has a short, stocky rhizome and produces only a few flowers per inflorescence, typically around three to five. Its leaves are dark green,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a rosette pattern. Angraecum oliganthum is adapted to grow in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its resilience in its native environment.
